SENT.plain: Thyrotoxic periodic paralysis is a rare and dramatic complication of hyperthyroidism
Thyrotoxic periodic paralysis classically presents with proximal lower limb weakness in the setting of hypokalemia and thyrotoxicosis

Thyrotoxic periodic paralysis represents an endocrine emergency with a rapidly ascending paralysis that can result in respiratory insufficiency, cardiac arrhythmias, and death if not accurately and rapidly diagnosed
We report a case of undiagnosed fatal thyrotoxic periodic paralysis presenting to the medical examiner
The diagnosis was made primarily by review of the clinical history
